definition: adj. 短暂的，转瞬即逝的
example: Fashion is ephemeral.

definition: n. 机缘巧合，意外发现珍宝的运气
example: Finding the cat was serendipity.

definition: adj. 有弹性的；有恢复力的
example: Cats are resilient.

definition: adj. 一丝不苟的，非常仔细的
example: Meticulous cleaning.
Photos bring back nostalgia.
Smartphones are ubiquitous now.
Measures were taken to alleviate the traffic congestion. (采取了措施来缓解交通拥堵。)

definition: adj. 模棱两可的，含糊不清的
example: The instructions were too ambiguous to follow. (这些指示太模棱两可，无法遵循。)

definition: adj. 连贯的，条理清晰的
example: Candidates need to present a coherent argument in the essay. (考生需要在文章中提出连贯的论点。)
Air quality has deteriorated rapidly in the city. (城市的空气质量迅速恶化了。)
There is a slight discrepancy between the two reports. (这两份报告之间存在细微的差异。)
Vegetable prices fluctuate according to the season. (蔬菜价格随季节波动。)
There is a strict hierarchy within the company. (公司内部有严格的等级制度。)
The new policy will be implemented next month. (新政策将于下个月实施。)
Bonus payments provide an incentive to work harder. (奖金提供了更加努力工作的动力。)

definition: adj. 不可避免的，必然发生的
example: Change is inevitable in a growing organization. (在一个成长中的组织里，变革是不可避免的。)
The exact mechanism of this disease is unknown. (这种疾病的确切发病机制尚不清楚。)
Globalization is a phenomenon of the 21st century. (全球化是21世纪的一种现象。)
These diseases are more prevalent among young children. (这些疾病在幼儿中更为普遍。)
He is a leading proponent of renewable energy. (他是可再生能源的主要支持者。)
All evidence was scrutinized by the police. (所有证据都经过了警方的仔细审查。)
The theory was developed subsequent to the earthquake. (这个理论是在地震之后发展起来的。)
We need to find a sustainable solution to this problem. (我们需要为这个问题找到一个可持续的解决方案。)
We need tangible evidence before taking action. (在采取行动之前，我们需要实质性的证据。)

definition: adj. 可行的，望能成功的
example: Is solar energy a viable alternative to oil? (太阳能是石油的可行替代品吗？)

definition: adj. 脆弱的，易受伤害的
example: Old people are particularly vulnerable to the flu. (老年人特别容易感染流感。)
